00037 #define COLOR_SIZE 3
00038 
00039 //----------------------------------mathutils.Color() -------------------
00040 //makes a new color for you to play with
00041 static PyObject *Color_new(PyTypeObject *type, PyObject *args, PyObject *kwds)
00042 {
00043     float col[3] = {0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f};
00044 
00045     if (kwds && PyDict_Size(kwds)) {
00046         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_TypeError,
00047                         "mathutils.Color(): "
00048                         "takes no keyword args");
00049         return NULL;
00050     }
00051 
00052     switch (PyTuple_GET_SIZE(args)) {
00053         case 0:
00054             break;
00055         case 1:
00056             if ((mathutils_array_parse(col, COLOR_SIZE, COLOR_SIZE, PyTuple_GET_ITEM(args, 0), "mathutils.Color()")) == -1)
00057                 return NULL;
00058             break;
00059         default:
00060             PyErr_SetString(PyExc_TypeError,
00061                             "mathutils.Color(): "
00062                             "more then a single arg given");
00063             return NULL;
00064     }
00065     return Color_CreatePyObject(col, Py_NEW, type);
00066 }

00068 //-----------------------------METHODS----------------------------

00070 /* note: BaseMath_ReadCallback must be called beforehand */
00071 static PyObject *Color_ToTupleExt(ColorObject *self, int ndigits)
00072 {
00073     PyObject *ret;
00074     int i;
00075 
00076     ret = PyTuple_New(COLOR_SIZE);
00077 
00078     if (ndigits >= 0) {
00079         for (i = 0; i < COLOR_SIZE; i++) {
00080             PyTuple_SET_ITEM(ret, i, PyFloat_FromDouble(double_round((double)self->col[i], ndigits)));
00081         }
00082     }
00083     else {
00084         for (i = 0; i < COLOR_SIZE; i++) {
00085             PyTuple_SET_ITEM(ret, i, PyFloat_FromDouble(self->col[i]));
00086         }
00087     }
00088 
00089     return ret;
00090 }

00092 PyDoc_STRVAR(Color_copy_doc,
00093 ".. function:: copy()\n"
00094 "\n"
00095 "   Returns a copy of this color.\n"
00096 "\n"
00097 "   :return: A copy of the color.\n"
00098 "   :rtype: :class:`Color`\n"
00099 "\n"
00100 "   .. note:: use this to get a copy of a wrapped color with\n"
00101 "      no reference to the original data.\n"
00102 );
00103 static PyObject *Color_copy(ColorObject *self)
00104 {
00105     if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(self) == -1)
00106         return NULL;
00107 
00108     return Color_CreatePyObject(self->col, Py_NEW, Py_TYPE(self));
00109 }
00110 static PyObject *Color_deepcopy(ColorObject *self, PyObject *args)
00111 {
00112     if (!mathutils_deepcopy_args_check(args))
00113         return NULL;
00114     return Color_copy(self);
00115 }

00117 //----------------------------print object (internal)--------------
00118 //print the object to screen
00119 
00120 static PyObject *Color_repr(ColorObject *self)
00121 {
00122     PyObject *ret, *tuple;
00123 
00124     if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(self) == -1)
00125         return NULL;
00126 
00127     tuple = Color_ToTupleExt(self, -1);
00128 
00129     ret = PyUnicode_FromFormat("Color(%R)", tuple);
00130 
00131     Py_DECREF(tuple);
00132     return ret;
00133 }

00135 static PyObject *Color_str(ColorObject *self)
00136 {
00137     DynStr *ds;
00138 
00139     if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(self) == -1)
00140         return NULL;
00141 
00142     ds = BLI_dynstr_new();
00143 
00144     BLI_dynstr_appendf(ds, "<Color (r=%.4f, g=%.4f, b=%.4f)>",
00145                        self->col[0], self->col[1], self->col[2]);
00146 
00147     return mathutils_dynstr_to_py(ds); /* frees ds */
00148 }

00150 //------------------------tp_richcmpr
00151 //returns -1 execption, 0 false, 1 true
00152 static PyObject *Color_richcmpr(PyObject *a, PyObject *b, int op)
00153 {
00154     PyObject *res;
00155     int ok = -1; /* zero is true */
00156 
00157     if (ColorObject_Check(a) && ColorObject_Check(b)) {
00158         ColorObject *colA = (ColorObject *)a;
00159         ColorObject *colB = (ColorObject *)b;
00160 
00161         if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(colA) == -1 || BaseMath_ReadCallback(colB) == -1)
00162             return NULL;
00163 
00164         ok = EXPP_VectorsAreEqual(colA->col, colB->col, COLOR_SIZE, 1) ? 0 : -1;
00165     }
00166 
00167     switch (op) {
00168         case Py_NE:
00169             ok = !ok; /* pass through */
00170         case Py_EQ:
00171             res = ok ? Py_False : Py_True;
00172             break;
00173 
00174         case Py_LT:
00175         case Py_LE:
00176         case Py_GT:
00177         case Py_GE:
00178             res = Py_NotImplemented;
00179             break;
00180         default:
00181             PyErr_BadArgument();
00182             return NULL;
00183     }
00184 
00185     return Py_INCREF(res), res;
00186 }

00188 //---------------------SEQUENCE PROTOCOLS------------------------
00189 //----------------------------len(object)------------------------
00190 //sequence length
00191 static int Color_len(ColorObject *UNUSED(self))
00192 {
00193     return COLOR_SIZE;
00194 }
00195 //----------------------------object[]---------------------------
00196 //sequence accessor (get)
00197 static PyObject *Color_item(ColorObject *self, int i)
00198 {
00199     if (i < 0) i = COLOR_SIZE - i;
00200 
00201     if (i < 0 || i >= COLOR_SIZE) {
00202         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_IndexError,
00203                         "color[item]: "
00204                         "array index out of range");
00205         return NULL;
00206     }
00207 
00208     if (BaseMath_ReadIndexCallback(self, i) == -1)
00209         return NULL;
00210 
00211     return PyFloat_FromDouble(self->col[i]);
00212 
00213 }
00214 //----------------------------object[]-------------------------
00215 //sequence accessor (set)
00216 static int Color_ass_item(ColorObject *self, int i, PyObject *value)
00217 {
00218     float f = PyFloat_AsDouble(value);
00219 
00220     if (f == -1 && PyErr_Occurred()) { // parsed item not a number
00221         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_TypeError,
00222                         "color[item] = x: "
00223                         "argument not a number");
00224         return -1;
00225     }
00226 
00227     if (i < 0) i = COLOR_SIZE - i;
00228 
00229     if (i < 0 || i >= COLOR_SIZE) {
00230         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_IndexError, "color[item] = x: "
00231                         "array assignment index out of range");
00232         return -1;
00233     }
00234 
00235     self->col[i] = f;
00236 
00237     if (BaseMath_WriteIndexCallback(self, i) == -1)
00238         return -1;
00239 
00240     return 0;
00241 }
00242 //----------------------------object[z:y]------------------------
00243 //sequence slice (get)
00244 static PyObject *Color_slice(ColorObject *self, int begin, int end)
00245 {
00246     PyObject *tuple;
00247     int count;
00248 
00249     if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(self) == -1)
00250         return NULL;
00251 
00252     CLAMP(begin, 0, COLOR_SIZE);
00253     if (end < 0) end = (COLOR_SIZE + 1) + end;
00254     CLAMP(end, 0, COLOR_SIZE);
00255     begin = MIN2(begin, end);
00256 
00257     tuple = PyTuple_New(end - begin);
00258     for (count = begin; count < end; count++) {
00259         PyTuple_SET_ITEM(tuple, count - begin, PyFloat_FromDouble(self->col[count]));
00260     }
00261 
00262     return tuple;
00263 }
00264 //----------------------------object[z:y]------------------------
00265 //sequence slice (set)
00266 static int Color_ass_slice(ColorObject *self, int begin, int end, PyObject *seq)
00267 {
00268     int i, size;
00269     float col[COLOR_SIZE];
00270 
00271     if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(self) == -1)
00272         return -1;
00273 
00274     CLAMP(begin, 0, COLOR_SIZE);
00275     if (end < 0) end = (COLOR_SIZE + 1) + end;
00276     CLAMP(end, 0, COLOR_SIZE);
00277     begin = MIN2(begin, end);
00278 
00279     if ((size = mathutils_array_parse(col, 0, COLOR_SIZE, seq, "mathutils.Color[begin:end] = []")) == -1)
00280         return -1;
00281 
00282     if (size != (end - begin)) {
00283         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
00284                         "color[begin:end] = []: "
00285                         "size mismatch in slice assignment");
00286         return -1;
00287     }
00288 
00289     for (i = 0; i < COLOR_SIZE; i++)
00290         self->col[begin + i] = col[i];
00291 
00292     (void)BaseMath_WriteCallback(self);
00293     return 0;
00294 }
00295 
00296 static PyObject *Color_subscript(ColorObject *self, PyObject *item)
00297 {
00298     if (PyIndex_Check(item)) {
00299         Py_ssize_t i;
00300         i = PyNumber_AsSsize_t(item, PyExc_IndexError);
00301         if (i == -1 && PyErr_Occurred())
00302             return NULL;
00303         if (i < 0)
00304             i += COLOR_SIZE;
00305         return Color_item(self, i);
00306     }
00307     else if (PySlice_Check(item)) {
00308         Py_ssize_t start, stop, step, slicelength;
00309 
00310         if (PySlice_GetIndicesEx((void *)item, COLOR_SIZE, &start, &stop, &step, &slicelength) < 0)
00311             return NULL;
00312 
00313         if (slicelength <= 0) {
00314             return PyTuple_New(0);
00315         }
00316         else if (step == 1) {
00317             return Color_slice(self, start, stop);
00318         }
00319         else {
00320             PyErr_SetString(PyExc_IndexError,
00321                             "slice steps not supported with color");
00322             return NULL;
00323         }
00324     }
00325     else {
00326         PyErr_Format(PyExc_TypeError,
00327                      "color indices must be integers, not %.200s",
00328                      Py_TYPE(item)->tp_name);
00329         return NULL;
00330     }
00331 }
00332 
00333 static int Color_ass_subscript(ColorObject *self, PyObject *item, PyObject *value)
00334 {
00335     if (PyIndex_Check(item)) {
00336         Py_ssize_t i = PyNumber_AsSsize_t(item, PyExc_IndexError);
00337         if (i == -1 && PyErr_Occurred())
00338             return -1;
00339         if (i < 0)
00340             i += COLOR_SIZE;
00341         return Color_ass_item(self, i, value);
00342     }
00343     else if (PySlice_Check(item)) {
00344         Py_ssize_t start, stop, step, slicelength;
00345 
00346         if (PySlice_GetIndicesEx((void *)item, COLOR_SIZE, &start, &stop, &step, &slicelength) < 0)
00347             return -1;
00348 
00349         if (step == 1)
00350             return Color_ass_slice(self, start, stop, value);
00351         else {
00352             PyErr_SetString(PyExc_IndexError,
00353                             "slice steps not supported with color");
00354             return -1;
00355         }
00356     }
00357     else {
00358         PyErr_Format(PyExc_TypeError,
00359                      "color indices must be integers, not %.200s",
00360                      Py_TYPE(item)->tp_name);
00361         return -1;
00362     }
00363 }

00388 /* addition: obj + obj */
00389 static PyObject *Color_add(PyObject *v1, PyObject *v2)
00390 {
00391     ColorObject *color1 = NULL, *color2 = NULL;
00392     float col[COLOR_SIZE];
00393 
00394     if (!ColorObject_Check(v1) || !ColorObject_Check(v2)) {
00395         PyErr_Format(PyExc_TypeError,
00396                      "Color addition: (%s + %s) "
00397                      "invalid type for this operation",
00398                      Py_TYPE(v1)->tp_name, Py_TYPE(v2)->tp_name);
00399         return NULL;
00400     }
00401     color1 = (ColorObject *)v1;
00402     color2 = (ColorObject *)v2;
00403 
00404     if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(color1) == -1 || BaseMath_ReadCallback(color2) == -1)
00405         return NULL;
00406 
00407     add_vn_vnvn(col, color1->col, color2->col, COLOR_SIZE);
00408 
00409     return Color_CreatePyObject(col, Py_NEW, Py_TYPE(v1));
00410 }

00419                      "Color addition: (%s += %s) "

00421                      Py_TYPE(v1)->tp_name, Py_TYPE(v2)->tp_name);
00422         return NULL;
00423     }
00424     color1 = (ColorObject *)v1;
00425     color2 = (ColorObject *)v2;
00426 
00427     if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(color1) == -1 || BaseMath_ReadCallback(color2) == -1)
00428         return NULL;
00429 
00430     add_vn_vn(color1->col, color2->col, COLOR_SIZE);
00431 
00432     (void)BaseMath_WriteCallback(color1);
00433     Py_INCREF(v1);
00434     return v1;
00435 }

00486 static PyObject *color_mul_float(ColorObject *color, const float scalar)
00487 {
00488     float tcol[COLOR_SIZE];
00489     mul_vn_vn_fl(tcol, color->col, COLOR_SIZE, scalar);
00490     return Color_CreatePyObject(tcol, Py_NEW, Py_TYPE(color));
00491 }

00493 
00494 static PyObject *Color_mul(PyObject *v1, PyObject *v2)
00495 {
00496     ColorObject *color1 = NULL, *color2 = NULL;
00497     float scalar;
00498 
00499     if (ColorObject_Check(v1)) {
00500         color1 = (ColorObject *)v1;
00501         if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(color1) == -1)
00502             return NULL;
00503     }
00504     if (ColorObject_Check(v2)) {
00505         color2 = (ColorObject *)v2;
00506         if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(color2) == -1)
00507             return NULL;
00508     }
00509 
00510 
00511     /* make sure v1 is always the vector */
00512     if (color1 && color2) {
00513         /* col * col, don't support yet! */
00514     }
00515     else if (color1) {
00516         if (((scalar = PyFloat_AsDouble(v2)) == -1.0f && PyErr_Occurred()) == 0) { /* COLOR * FLOAT */
00517             return color_mul_float(color1, scalar);
00518         }
00519     }
00520     else if (color2) {
00521         if (((scalar = PyFloat_AsDouble(v1)) == -1.0f && PyErr_Occurred()) == 0) { /* FLOAT * COLOR */
00522             return color_mul_float(color2, scalar);
00523         }
00524     }
00525     else {
00526         BLI_assert(!"internal error");
00527     }
00528 
00529     PyErr_Format(PyExc_TypeError,
00530                  "Color multiplication: not supported between "
00531                  "'%.200s' and '%.200s' types",
00532                  Py_TYPE(v1)->tp_name, Py_TYPE(v2)->tp_name);
00533     return NULL;
00534 }
00535 
00536 static PyObject *Color_div(PyObject *v1, PyObject *v2)
00537 {
00538     ColorObject *color1 = NULL;
00539     float scalar;
00540 
00541     if (ColorObject_Check(v1)) {
00542         color1 = (ColorObject *)v1;
00543         if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(color1) == -1)
00544             return NULL;
00545     }
00546     else {
00547         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_TypeError,
00548                         "Color division not supported in this order");
00549         return NULL;
00550     }
00551 
00552     /* make sure v1 is always the vector */
00553     if (((scalar = PyFloat_AsDouble(v2)) == -1.0f && PyErr_Occurred()) == 0) { /* COLOR * FLOAT */
00554         if (scalar == 0.0f) {
00555             PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ZeroDivisionError,
00556                             "Color division: divide by zero error");
00557             return NULL;
00558         }
00559         return color_mul_float(color1, 1.0f / scalar);
00560     }
00561 
00562     PyErr_Format(PyExc_TypeError,
00563                  "Color multiplication: not supported between "
00564                  "'%.200s' and '%.200s' types",
00565                  Py_TYPE(v1)->tp_name, Py_TYPE(v2)->tp_name);
00566     return NULL;
00567 }
00568 
00569 /* mulplication in-place: obj *= obj */
00570 static PyObject *Color_imul(PyObject *v1, PyObject *v2)
00571 {
00572     ColorObject *color = (ColorObject *)v1;
00573     float scalar;
00574 
00575     if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(color) == -1)
00576         return NULL;
00577 
00578     /* only support color *= float */
00579     if (((scalar = PyFloat_AsDouble(v2)) == -1.0f && PyErr_Occurred()) == 0) { /* COLOR *= FLOAT */
00580         mul_vn_fl(color->col, COLOR_SIZE, scalar);
00581     }
00582     else {
00583         PyErr_Format(PyExc_TypeError,
00584                      "Color multiplication: (%s *= %s) "
00585                      "invalid type for this operation",
00586                      Py_TYPE(v1)->tp_name, Py_TYPE(v2)->tp_name);
00587         return NULL;
00588     }
00589 
00590     (void)BaseMath_WriteCallback(color);
00591     Py_INCREF(v1);
00592     return v1;
00593 }
00594 
00595 /* mulplication in-place: obj *= obj */
00596 static PyObject *Color_idiv(PyObject *v1, PyObject *v2)
00597 {
00598     ColorObject *color = (ColorObject *)v1;
00599     float scalar;
00600 
00601     if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(color) == -1)
00602         return NULL;
00603 
00604     /* only support color /= float */
00605     if (((scalar = PyFloat_AsDouble(v2)) == -1.0f && PyErr_Occurred()) == 0) { /* COLOR /= FLOAT */
00606         if (scalar == 0.0f) {
00607             PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ZeroDivisionError,
00608                             "Color division: divide by zero error");
00609             return NULL;
00610         }
00611 
00612         mul_vn_fl(color->col, COLOR_SIZE, 1.0f / scalar);
00613     }
00614     else {
00615         PyErr_Format(PyExc_TypeError,
00616                      "Color division: (%s /= %s) "
00617                      "invalid type for this operation",
00618                      Py_TYPE(v1)->tp_name, Py_TYPE(v2)->tp_name);
00619         return NULL;
00620     }
00621 
00622     (void)BaseMath_WriteCallback(color);
00623     Py_INCREF(v1);
00624     return v1;
00625 }
00626 
00627 /* -obj
00628  * returns the negative of this object */
00629 static PyObject *Color_neg(ColorObject *self)
00630 {
00631     float tcol[COLOR_SIZE];
00632 
00633     if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(self) == -1)
00634         return NULL;
00635 
00636     negate_vn_vn(tcol, self->col, COLOR_SIZE);
00637     return Color_CreatePyObject(tcol, Py_NEW, Py_TYPE(self));
00638 }

00641 static PyNumberMethods Color_NumMethods = {
00642     (binaryfunc) Color_add, /*nb_add*/
00643     (binaryfunc) Color_sub, /*nb_subtract*/
00644     (binaryfunc) Color_mul, /*nb_multiply*/
00645     NULL,               /*nb_remainder*/
00646     NULL,               /*nb_divmod*/
00647     NULL,               /*nb_power*/
00648     (unaryfunc) Color_neg, /*nb_negative*/
00649     (unaryfunc) NULL,   /*tp_positive*/
00650     (unaryfunc) NULL,   /*tp_absolute*/
00651     (inquiry)   NULL,   /*tp_bool*/
00652     (unaryfunc) NULL,   /*nb_invert*/

00678 /* color channel, vector.r/g/b */
00679 PyDoc_STRVAR(Color_channel_r_doc, "Red color channel.\n\n:type: float");
00680 PyDoc_STRVAR(Color_channel_g_doc, "Green color channel.\n\n:type: float");
00681 PyDoc_STRVAR(Color_channel_b_doc, "Blue color channel.\n\n:type: float");
00682 
00683 static PyObject *Color_channel_get(ColorObject *self, void *type)
00684 {
00685     return Color_item(self, GET_INT_FROM_POINTER(type));
00686 }
00687 
00688 static int Color_channel_set(ColorObject *self, PyObject *value, void *type)
00689 {
00690     return Color_ass_item(self, GET_INT_FROM_POINTER(type), value);
00691 }
00692 
00693 /* color channel (HSV), color.h/s/v */
00694 PyDoc_STRVAR(Color_channel_hsv_h_doc, "HSV Hue component in [0, 1].\n\n:type: float");
00695 PyDoc_STRVAR(Color_channel_hsv_s_doc, "HSV Saturation component in [0, 1].\n\n:type: float");
00696 PyDoc_STRVAR(Color_channel_hsv_v_doc, "HSV Value component in [0, 1].\n\n:type: float");
00697 
00698 static PyObject *Color_channel_hsv_get(ColorObject *self, void *type)
00699 {
00700     float hsv[3];
00701     int i = GET_INT_FROM_POINTER(type);
00702 
00703     if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(self) == -1)
00704         return NULL;
00705 
00706     rgb_to_hsv(self->col[0], self->col[1], self->col[2], &(hsv[0]), &(hsv[1]), &(hsv[2]));
00707 
00708     return PyFloat_FromDouble(hsv[i]);
00709 }
00710 
00711 static int Color_channel_hsv_set(ColorObject *self, PyObject *value, void *type)
00712 {
00713     float hsv[3];
00714     int i = GET_INT_FROM_POINTER(type);
00715     float f = PyFloat_AsDouble(value);
00716 
00717     if (f == -1 && PyErr_Occurred()) {
00718         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_TypeError,
00719                         "color.h/s/v = value: "
00720                         "argument not a number");
00721         return -1;
00722     }
00723 
00724     if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(self) == -1)
00725         return -1;
00726 
00727     rgb_to_hsv(self->col[0], self->col[1], self->col[2], &(hsv[0]), &(hsv[1]), &(hsv[2]));
00728     CLAMP(f, 0.0f, 1.0f);
00729     hsv[i] = f;
00730     hsv_to_rgb(hsv[0], hsv[1], hsv[2], &(self->col[0]), &(self->col[1]), &(self->col[2]));
00731 
00732     if (BaseMath_WriteCallback(self) == -1)
00733         return -1;
00734 
00735     return 0;
00736 }
00737 
00738 /* color channel (HSV), color.h/s/v */
00739 PyDoc_STRVAR(Color_hsv_doc, "HSV Values in [0, 1].\n\n:type: float triplet");
00740 static PyObject *Color_hsv_get(ColorObject *self, void *UNUSED(closure))
00741 {
00742     float hsv[3];
00743     PyObject *ret;
00744 
00745     if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(self) == -1)
00746         return NULL;
00747 
00748     rgb_to_hsv(self->col[0], self->col[1], self->col[2], &(hsv[0]), &(hsv[1]), &(hsv[2]));
00749 
00750     ret = PyTuple_New(3);
00751     PyTuple_SET_ITEM(ret, 0, PyFloat_FromDouble(hsv[0]));
00752     PyTuple_SET_ITEM(ret, 1, PyFloat_FromDouble(hsv[1]));
00753     PyTuple_SET_ITEM(ret, 2, PyFloat_FromDouble(hsv[2]));
00754     return ret;
00755 }
00756 
00757 static int Color_hsv_set(ColorObject *self, PyObject *value, void *UNUSED(closure))
00758 {
00759     float hsv[3];
00760 
00761     if (mathutils_array_parse(hsv, 3, 3, value, "mathutils.Color.hsv = value") == -1)
00762         return -1;
00763 
00764     CLAMP(hsv[0], 0.0f, 1.0f);
00765     CLAMP(hsv[1], 0.0f, 1.0f);
00766     CLAMP(hsv[2], 0.0f, 1.0f);
00767 
00768     hsv_to_rgb(hsv[0], hsv[1], hsv[2], &(self->col[0]), &(self->col[1]), &(self->col[2]));
00769 
00770     if (BaseMath_WriteCallback(self) == -1)
00771         return -1;
00772 
00773     return 0;
00774 }

00856 //------------------------Color_CreatePyObject (internal)-------------
00857 //creates a new color object
00858 /* pass Py_WRAP - if vector is a WRAPPER for data allocated by BLENDER
00859  *  (i.e. it was allocated elsewhere by MEM_mallocN())
00860  *   pass Py_NEW - if vector is not a WRAPPER and managed by PYTHON
00861  *  (i.e. it must be created here with PyMEM_malloc())*/
00862 PyObject *Color_CreatePyObject(float *col, int type, PyTypeObject *base_type)
00863 {
00864     ColorObject *self;
00865 
00866     self = base_type ?  (ColorObject *)base_type->tp_alloc(base_type, 0) :
00867                         (ColorObject *)PyObject_GC_New(ColorObject, &color_Type);
00868 
00869     if (self) {
00870         /* init callbacks as NULL */
00871         self->cb_user = NULL;
00872         self->cb_type = self->cb_subtype = 0;
00873 
00874         if (type == Py_WRAP) {
00875             self->col = col;
00876             self->wrapped = Py_WRAP;
00877         }
00878         else if (type == Py_NEW) {
00879             self->col = PyMem_Malloc(COLOR_SIZE * sizeof(float));
00880             if (col)
00881                 copy_v3_v3(self->col, col);
00882             else
00883                 zero_v3(self->col);
00884 
00885             self->wrapped = Py_NEW;
00886         }
00887         else {
00888             Py_FatalError("Color(): invalid type!");
00889         }
00890     }
00891 
00892     return (PyObject *)self;
00893 }
00894 
00895 PyObject *Color_CreatePyObject_cb(PyObject *cb_user,
00896                                   unsigned char cb_type, unsigned char cb_subtype)
00897 {
00898     ColorObject *self = (ColorObject *)Color_CreatePyObject(NULL, Py_NEW, NULL);
00899     if (self) {
00900         Py_INCREF(cb_user);
00901         self->cb_user         = cb_user;
00902         self->cb_type         = cb_type;
00903         self->cb_subtype      = cb_subtype;
00904         PyObject_GC_Track(self);
00905     }
00906 
00907     return (PyObject *)self;
00908 }
